sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A proclamation made and proclaimed in Holland, &c. by the lords the generall States of the vnited Netherland Prouinces, prohibiting all Iesuites, priests, monkes, friers, and other spirituall persons of the Romish religion, to come into the vnited Netherland Prouinces, or to stay therein, &c. As also that no man shall send any children out of the said vnited Netherlands to schoole or to boord, in any townes, places, vniuersities or schooles, vnder the King of Spaines commaund, into the enemies countrey, nor into any Iesuites colledges. As also not to make any collections or gatherings of money, gold and siluer minted and vnminted, or of any other goods, wares, or marchandizes, for, or to behoofe of any churches, hospitalls, ecclesiasticall or other colledges or couents. United Provinces of the Netherlands. Staten Generaal.
[4], 8 p.
By Hillebrany Iacobson [i.e. B. Alsop] Printer to the States, Printed at the Hage [i.e. London] : 1622.
The imprint is false; actual printer's name and publication date from STC. "The Printers Priuiledge" appears on final page, recto. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
A proclamation made and proclaimed in Holland, &c. by the lords the generall States of the vnited Netherland Prouinces, prohibiting all Iesuites, priests, monkes, friers, and other spirituall persons of the Romish religion, to come into the vnited Netherland Prouinces, or to stay therein, &c. As also that no man shall send any children out of the said vnited Netherlands to schoole or to boord, in any townes, places, vniuersities or schooles, vnder the King of Spaines commaund, into the enemies countrey, nor into any Iesuites colledges. As also not to make any collections or gatherings of money, gold and siluer minted and vnminted, or of any other goods, wares, or marchandizes, for, or to behoofe of any churches, hospitalls, ecclesiasticall or other colledges or couents. United Provinces of the Netherlands. Staten Generaal.
[4], 8 p.
By Hillebrany Iacobson [i.e. B. Alsop] Printer to the States, Printed at the Hage [i.e. London] : 1622.
The imprint is false; actual printer's name and publication date from STC. "The Printers Priuiledge" appears on final page, recto. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
the States
Hillebrany Iacobson [i.e. B. Alsop]
